tool.name: SAGA.pj_proj4.20
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPLANAR False output_data_ORTHODROME $output_data_ORTHODROME output_data_LOXODROME $output_data_LOXODROME name SAGA.pj_proj4.20 PLANAR $PLANAR EPSILON $EPSILON prefer $prefer response $response outputType_ORTHODROME $OutputSection_ORTHODROME.outputType_ORTHODROME transmissionMode_ORTHODROME $OutputSection_ORTHODROME.transmissionMode_ORTHODROME outputType_LOXODROME $OutputSection_LOXODROME.outputType_LOXODROME transmissionMode_LOXODROME $OutputSection_LOXODROME.transmissionMode_LOXODROME

param.name: PLANAR
param.label: Segments
param.help: Segments The following data types are allowed in the txt file: xml, json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml

param.name: EPSILON
param.label: Epsilon
param.help: defines the maximum resolution [km] for the re-projected distance segments

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_ORTHODROME
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_LOXODROME
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: Calculates for all segments of the input lines the planar, great elliptic, and loxodrome distance and re-projects the latter two to the projection of the input lines. <br/>Projection routines make use of the Proj.4 Cartographic Projections library.<br/>Proj.4 was originally developed by Gerald Evenden and later continued by the United States Department of the Interior, Geological Survey (USGS).<br/>Proj.4 Version is Rel. 5.2.0, September 15th, 2018<br/><a target="_blank" href="http://trac.osgeo.org/proj/">Proj.4 Homepage</a>
